website_summaries.verdict: A versatile and affordable French fry cutter for the occasional homemade French fry maker.
pros: Comes with 3 interchangeable blades for a variety of cuts
cons: Only cuts small or trimmed down potatoes

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace another unit that was similar in function, which had lost a blade after about 10years. I decided to give this one a try and what I found out that you can only use small potatoes and the suction base would not stay well enough to hold the unit in place, unlike the old unit, whose suction base worked fine after 10 years. It was also very hard to get a potato through the blades. I returned the unit promplty.
customer_reviews.author: SLC Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed to say the least Like so many home cheaper ...
customer_reviews.text: after buying and returning a similar model, I purchased this model. It worked ok as long as you had a potato that was soft and you cut one end off. After a few uses the whole arm of the pusher just collapsed. Very disappointed to say the least Like so many home cheaper appliances, this product has very flimsy construction and cannot handle tougher jobs. Don't expect too much from it, it is basically a toy.
customer_reviews.author: W. Page

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be bigger
customer_reviews.text: While this did cut potatoes nicely, you can only fit small potatoes in this. A regular potato needs to be cut in half so you only get short french fries!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Welsh

customer_reviews.title: If You like long fries,not for you
customer_reviews.text: Not for you ,if you like long fries. Works surprisingly well with white potatoes. In my experience, best to cut long potatoes in half and place FLAT SIDE towards push plate. Next tip --use dash of PAM on blades. After few tries, FACING AWAY TOWARDS THE WALL better worked for me with getting momentum going. PULL is better mechanics than try it from side to side. It is good gadget for kitchen. One star was taken away for pricing point.54$ for plastic?
customer_reviews.author: Val T.

customer_reviews.title: good little machine, BUT
customer_reviews.text: was excited aobut seeing a small size french fry cutter, most only cut large fries. BUT... when i go the machine i discovered that it was only really good for midget potatoes . . . also found it hard to find place for vacuum cup to stick and hold
customer_reviews.author: waldoii

customer_reviews.title: Miserable Little Fries that tasted good anyway
customer_reviews.text: I'm confused by the positive reviews for this cutter. From the very first use, it was difficult to operate. First, you need to cut all your potatoes into very small pieces in order to fit into the 3 inch long chamber. I was kind of hoping for a little longer fry length. Perhaps my expectations were too high based on the reviews. The blades bent under the stress of the first potato. I straightened them as much as possible and continued with MUCH smaller pieces. Finally, I ended up with a batch of 2 inch potatoes pieces. I'll now be searching for a cutter that boasts a better grade.
customer_reviews.author: OBX

customer_reviews.title: bad item
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed the very first time I used the cutter and found out you have cut the potatoes in half for them to be cut by the cutter...some potatoes you even have to cut into quarters....they don't tell you any of this in the description of the cutter before you buy it....I would have never bought this had I known!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Graham

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: save your money, this is a cheap toy. You have to cut any reasonable sized potato into pieces to even fit it in the thing, then just go ahead and try to get a clean cut. You might until the last 1/2" the thing won't even finush the slices, it doesn't feed far enough into the cutter so you have to pull the potato thru, cheap toy. Useless!
customer_reviews.author: PcW

customer_reviews.title: Watch where you order from.
customer_reviews.text: One of the cutters broke after only a few times of use. I tried to contact the company to get it replaced, as there is a five year warranty on it. But was unable to contact the company. I should have realized the ordering something made in China and sold by a company in Germany was not going to be good. Never again will I order anything from the Westmark company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My french fries cutter
customer_reviews.text: I can now make my own french fries and in the size I want it. No added salt or preservatives. I cook my fries in my air cooker and they come out perfect for us. Even the children likes to use it. Helps them to learn to cook and to enjoy cooking. Thank you so much. We love it. I just wish there was a cutter to cut onions otherwise.....
customer_reviews.author: Naomi E Manning

customer_reviews.title: Low quality parts
customer_reviews.text: Today I am using the item for the second time and the arm would not fully go down. After closer inspection, I noticed that the blades were bent and the plastic could not push the potato through. This appears to have happened the first time I used it because this happened with the first potato I tried to slice today. Very dissappointed and I cant eben find replacement parts on line. Would like a refund or to trade up to a sturdier model.
customer_reviews.author: Laudelino Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Okay if you are only making regular fries.
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend buying the next level up. The product did the job, but it is not very sturdy, especially if you are using it to make sweet potato fries, The sweet potatoes are a lot tougher and larger than regular white potatoes so you have to make a lot of adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Cool but....1 disadvantage
customer_reviews.text: This gadget works very well and I like the 3 sizes of cutting blades. I have a little trouble getting it to stick to the counter but that's not worrisome. The one complaint that I have is that it is too short - if you have a medium or larger russet, you have to cut it to get it to fit. Unfortunate because I like long fries.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Kienzle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cutter, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Will slice pretty much any fruit or veggie minus tomatoes. The suction cup feature makes it easy to place and hold on the counter surface and using it is super easy. I bought this for my 66 year old mother who has arthritis in her hands. After watching her use it (with ease) she really enjoys the product
customer_reviews.author: Adrial

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and blades don’t stay sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap junk. Product is not big enough to fit a normal size potato. You have to cut 1/4 of the potato off each end and push it almost all the way through then attach the end that pushes the potato the rest of the way through the blades. Blades are cheap and dull quickly. We’ve cut about 8 potatoes through it and now the blades are dull and you have to put some body weight behind the handle to push it through. Will be returning this item for sure. The one good thing is you have 3 different size options to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. I did 10 lbs of russet potatoes and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I did 10 lbs of russet potatoes and really had to give it the elbow grease to make the fries, but it held up fine. Seems to be of high Quality although I have not tried the other cutters yet. Did use it on onions too and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like It for Onions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to change blades and clean up. Suction pad works good locking it down and doesn't slip as long as the surface is dry. Works smoothly and if it starts catching a bit I put a dab of vegetable oil on the works and that fixes the issue. I would have preferred the cutting area to be a little larger but that's my fault for not paying attention to the exact dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Doug E.

customer_reviews.title: Would not waste money on this - broke during first use on ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is very cheap and very small. Would not waste money on this - broke during first use on zucchini.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyAZ

customer_reviews.title: All those bad reviews are people abusing it, Its fine, I'm 260lbs and I push on it.
customer_reviews.text: I read someones review on here and he was right, Just slide the end of your potatoe FLAT, and that end go in the blades, this takes ALOT of stress off pushing on just 1 little blade tab with a pointy potatoe. Also much smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Never actually used it for potatoes. I mostly use it for dicing onions and peppers for salsa and cucumbers for relish. Works awesome for that. Nice looking cuts
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Have fun!
customer_reviews.text: Small or cut up potatoes only. It’s ok. Fun to use. Brought back memories from childhood when we had a monster big French fry maker that could cut a whole baking potato. This one is little baby potatoes. Cute.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: You better be fairly strong...
customer_reviews.text: This works OK for occasional use, but requires a LOT of force and a little bit of learning curve to get potatoes in at the right angle so they don't jam. In fact my wife was not able to do it. It seems the plastic is stressing close to breaking, but nothing has broken yet. I wish I had purchased one of the bigger all metal ones with less flexing and more mechanical advantage.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first because of the price and some bad reviews. However, I’ve used this several times over the course of about a month to cut skin on potatoes and I’ve had no issues with it. You have to use smaller potatoes and sometimes put some strength in your press, but I’ve gotten perfect cut fries every time.
customer_reviews.author: K L

customer_reviews.title: Cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cutter but you need strength to push out the potato and the suction doesn't always hold up 😊 Just don't buy it if you don't have strength to push it hard. 😊 I still use it and find if I use smaller potatoes it's easier. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Janis McMahon

customer_reviews.title: good product and works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this appliance to replace an older cutter. Very pleased with this model . Works well with all three blades and seems to stay sharp. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Harris G. Wilks

customer_reviews.title: Great French Fry Cutter
customer_reviews.text: It's great. It was a replacement for one we've had for about 10 years. This is very light-weight and easy to use, and very inexpensive. I would recommend this to everyone .
customer_reviews.author: DMH_FAIRVIEW

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. I feel like I wasted my money. It’s only for super small potatoes (like red or yellow ones.) Also it would not allow me to close it with out making my potato pop out of the cutter. Also the grid wasn’t sharp enough to slice through my potato. I am extremely disappointed... I was sssssooooo ready to use it only to find it not working.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Snelling

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for those with RA
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has lived with RA for far too long it is a treasure to find a kitchen tool that helps me make family staples again. I had to lean down and put the weight of my upper body into play in order to “push’ the potatoes through but they were perfect! It is a simple but special treasure and much better than frozen potatoes:)
customer_reviews.author: A reader in North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Only holds small items for cutting
customer_reviews.text: Potatoes must be cut into pieces to fit into the unit. Also, often the blade cartridge pops up and food gets underneath it. You will have to remove the cartridge, clean it out and put it back in. It is pretty sturdy and gets the job done. I wish it had larger and smaller blade cartridges and a way to cross cut vegetables as they come out.
customer_reviews.author: David in Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the past needs to stay there.
customer_reviews.text: I just have to say that I wish I purchased this first. Being nostalgic for the 60's/70's (my formative years), I went with a certain o'matic product. Boy was I disappointed. I guess my produce was too touch for the fragile blades. Picking up this puppy was the right move. I'm able to cut the same amount, but the whole device is much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: James H Branch

customer_reviews.title: Can get jammed, but easily prevented
customer_reviews.text: This cutter works just fine, but you'll probably want to hold the blade inserts down as you're cutting. They have a tendency to slide up as you push the potato through, which causes it to get jammed. But it certainly makes fine fries!
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Clegg

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best Quality
customer_reviews.text: The blade system is not secure, and moves, which offsets the cutting mechanism. The blades need to lock in.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: Nearly cut my finger-poor quality-dangerous
customer_reviews.text: First time using it....sliced about seven small potatoes. When I went to retrieve the potatoes from the other end...a blade had come off and was sticking it. It all but sliced my finger, so thankful I did not get cut. Piece of junk, and dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This pos breaks after 1 tater
customer_reviews.text: Worst piece of equipment ever, it broke so quickly I don't even want my money back let alone a replacement trash piece. 1 potato was fine, the moment a second potato went in the blades popped out of their square holder. Save yourself the time and money and use a knife which is what I will be going back to post review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: homemade fries
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. don't use big potatoes because they won't fit in the slot. wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: night shift worker

customer_reviews.title: It's a great accessory to go with his air fryer
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for me last Christmas. It's a great accessory to go with his air fryer. We can make homemade french fries. It is so simple to use and the clean up is quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: great slicer
customer_reviews.text: made french fries only slicer I could find to cut large fries instead of shoestring great
customer_reviews.author: dawn jones

customer_reviews.title: Beware of small bits of plastic shaved into food.
customer_reviews.text: The blades have too much flex that they can/will shave small bits of plastic off the pushing pad. This in essence makes the device unsafe too use.
customer_reviews.author: basil_

customer_reviews.title: I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Broken pieces that. Missing pieces. The potato slices are very small. This is the kind of product that you should spend a little more money and get a higher quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: R. E.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly and in condition advertised. Made in Germany ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in condition advertised. Made in Germany. Directions? on two sides of package but none in English. Guess we just have to figure it out ourselves. Funny
customer_reviews.author: Jacdandar

customer_reviews.title: Not the product I thought I was buying
customer_reviews.text: Too small for most potatoes. Have to quarter the potato to use which defeats the who purpose of buying this. I was hoping this would save time from cutting fries by hand with a knife but this isn't worth it in my opinion. Also, after the first use the blade broke. I would not recommend this to anyone. Labeled as if it is made in Germany however has the quality of Chinese.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use, if i had bought at big box store it would be returned.
customer_reviews.text: try not to complain, try to give companies the benefit of the doubt, but it broke the second time we used it. buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Smith15

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several products that promised to cut frys easily. They all disappointed me badly, but not this one, it worked GREAT! The suction fastened easily and the cutter really worked. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Hall

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hmm! Hard to get potatoes out once cut. Forget using large potatoes
customer_reviews.author: sita levy

customer_reviews.title: Knife plates bend easily.
customer_reviews.text: Knife plate, the largest one bent first time we used it. we would like a replacement. We only need largest one. Please contact us as to how we can get it. 503-871-3422 Kathy Olson 3100 Turner Rd. Salem Oregon 97302 . We like everything else about the product. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: kathy olson

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had seen the photos of this product from other customers before hand., I used it one time and it looks identical to the horrible photo I just saw. Not sturdy. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Martin

customer_reviews.title: The cutter worked great cutting a sweet potato that I soften a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: It came today. The cutter worked great cutting a sweet potato that I soften a bit in the microwave. I have yet to try other vegetables. I am hoping the blades don't get dull after a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: OHGAL

customer_reviews.title: Crop
customer_reviews.text: The first potato that was put in the slicer was the last one the metal blades broke off in 3 places
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Huge potatoes don't fit in it
customer_reviews.text: It's nice but only small potatoes fit. I guess I should have checked to make sure larger potato's fit. For the price it's great.
customer_reviews.author: JC in the house

customer_reviews.title: The worst potatoe cutter  ever
customer_reviews.text: Horrible ! It's doesn't work at all ! Waste of money ! Potatoes get stuck in there , you have to use some force to try to take it out , then I had to take it out with a knife ! 👎🏻👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOod for fries...but not sure if it will last
customer_reviews.text: First off. I think its a good product and idea. But the materials (plastic and light metals) may not hold up for long. to be seen. will update after a while.
customer_reviews.author: JPizzle

customer_reviews.title: Not very good unit.
customer_reviews.text: Too difficult to use. Very small capacity. Does not work with sweet potatoes. Broke after a month of use. Supposedly a five year guarantee but cannot return to Amazon. I would recommend a better quality unit for sweet potato fries.
customer_reviews.author: john turner

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works Great for potatoes! Fast shipping, very happy with product....my husband is a little rough on things and it has held up fine! I would definately purchase again, I thought it was a good price, I love that is comes with 3 different size blades! and the suction cup is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lil T

customer_reviews.title: Was very disappointed in the product
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in the product. Only able to use very small potatoes, thus only made very small French fries. Did not receive any instructions on use of product. No paperwork was included. Did receive the cutter one day after scheduled.
customer_reviews.author: Billie K.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun to make fries at home.
customer_reviews.text: So much fun to make fries at home. I love to cook and save time. This French fry cutter makes everything much easier. I can have my fries ready for my family and friends on no time. The best thing is it looks like I bought the fries because it is very even cut and it will cook much evenly. This is definitely a healthier option to bake my fries at home or make veggie fries, which is my new favorite now. I also like that I have options with the three blades because I can be creative with my cooking.
customer_reviews.author: EMELIE HEFTI VIRLOUVET

customer_reviews.title: No durable
customer_reviews.text: I would like the company that sold this to contact me. One of the blade fittings came apart and the red plastic cushion started to break apart when I was cutting a sweet potato. I want a replacement or I want my money back. I have only used this 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Weijts

customer_reviews.title: The French get cutter is easy to use and fabulous
customer_reviews.text: The French get cutter is easy to use and fabulous. I had a little trouble keeping it steady but will keep practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy pre-cut fries again
customer_reviews.text: Great French fry cutter but the potatoes have to be short in length. Therefore for the most part one will have to cut the potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandros M. Collie

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to make French fries, only works if ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to make French fries , only works if potato is soft , if the potato is slightly hard or hard the handle to push the potato gets jammed only with the potato half way in and it gets very troublesome to takeout the half done potato out.. handle got to have more pressing power and peeler with more sharp blades
customer_reviews.author: HIRAO AFTAB

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item over others based on the reviews. On receiving and trying to use, I discovered that the area where you place the potato to be cut is so small it will not even accomodate a SMALL potato. I'd like to return it but I've used it, the box it came in is gone and I'm left it.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life
customer_reviews.text: OK, saved my chips, they cook evenly now and so easy to use and clean. I didn't know there were chip cutters out there.
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: small fry
customer_reviews.text: works great except that you can only use smaller potatoes for French fries. also the mechanical advantage of the arm is a bit lacking but it works well with easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Too tiny, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tiny. It cannot fit an entire potato. Let me say that AGAIN-THIS IS A FRENCH FRY CUTTER THAT CAN'T FIT A POTATO! I would deinitely not recommend this unless you want to halve your potatoes for extra small fries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a great cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. First push took more strength than I expected, but it got easy after that. It does a great job on spuds Haven't tried anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old fashion Stanless Steel French Fry Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Will have to do. Not like the old fashion Stanless Steel French Fry Cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy spud cuts
customer_reviews.text: I love using this handy tool in the kitchen, makes perfect cut potato frys every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then it looks
customer_reviews.text: This will not cut sweet potatoes and all potatoes have to be cut into small pieces before you can use this
customer_reviews.author: Justin case

customer_reviews.title: great suction
customer_reviews.text: We use this to make french fries. the potato fries are fairly easy, but the sweet potato is a harder consistently and take a lot of elbow power.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Fries to short
customer_reviews.text: its fine if you like short fries. you have to cut your potatoes in half to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Evans

customer_reviews.title: Is as described
customer_reviews.text: was just what I was looking for. The product performed as stated, the only issue I have is it does not suction to my counter because it is not a smooth surface.
customer_reviews.author: Nanziepooh

customer_reviews.title: Used once
customer_reviews.text: We unpacked it and used once and the blades bent. Not good at all for potatoes. We cut potatoes in half, blades are not strong.
customer_reviews.author: Robert White

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: hate it the cups don't hold the device down and the machine broke on my second use of the thing on a normal potato.
customer_reviews.author: Isis Moonstar

customer_reviews.title: This product is a terrible it came all bent up without screws and not ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a terrible it came all bent up without screws and not usable I waited too late to open the box so I just my money. I am finding so many things that you should buy off the shelf instead of Amazon. Don't make the mistake of leaving in the box until you want to use it or you will get screwed like I did
customer_reviews.author: John Butz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works. But have to cut down most spuds to fit in cutter. Suction cup works well, would be nice if cutter was a little bit higher.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wooley

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: First time I used this product to cut sweet potato the entire blade bent. Bad quality does not perform as described. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE it. Would like to see more of your products. THANKS for making such a Good product. THANKS
customer_reviews.author: mark eddy

customer_reviews.title: otherwise I used it Saturday and it worked out so I am happy I guess
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was a bit more heavy duty, seemed a bit weak a couple of times I ran a potato through it and I had to trim several potatoes so they would fit, otherwise I used it Saturday and it worked out so I am happy I guess, I ike it with reservations I guess I will say. Thanks for having it. Ron Lester
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lester

customer_reviews.title: SMALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product works well but you can only put small potatoes in it, limiting you to what kind of potatoes you can use for French fries.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Backus

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: Way to small, have use very small potatoes or have to cut to machines size.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Bots

customer_reviews.title: will be fine for small items
customer_reviews.text: will be fine for small items. large potatoes will not fit they would have to be cut. Worked real well on onions after cut in half with the middle blade size.
customer_reviews.author: Nated14

customer_reviews.title: Not worth purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Not great quality and difficult to use. Makes very short fries if you can even get it to cut the potato. Find a different one.

customer_reviews.title: If your looking for small this is it
customer_reviews.text: This item is real small and there is no English instructions. And small as in i have to cut my potatoes in half
customer_reviews.author: Javan Louis

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent french fries
customer_reviews.text: Works just as I hoped it would. Makes excellent french fries.
customer_reviews.author: uncle joe

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The metal cutters are made of very thin metal and will not survive. The unit was destroyed after the third potato.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy customer

customer_reviews.title: IT BREAKS EASY
customer_reviews.text: the cutter blades break easy and if you have big veggies....have to cut them up to start with...very dissatisfied with this item...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what you want it to do.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Not much more to say. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: outonleave

customer_reviews.title: Works great but you have to cut most potatoes in to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but you have to cut most potatoes in to smaller pieces so they can fit into the machine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A longer area to put item in would be better, in other words you get short french fries
customer_reviews.text: Works well for medium size potatoes. Large potatoes, you have to cut to fit. A longer area to put item in would be better, in other words you get short french fries.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: It's a good utensil, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is very solid and well made. Two things disappointed me: first, it's A German company, but it is made in China. Secondly, there were no instruction leaflets in the box or on the box. It was easy to figure out, but I don't know if it's dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lazar

customer_reviews.title: Especially when they are freshly cut and this happens to now be his favorite thing and money maker for his little league football ...
customer_reviews.text: My brother is a French fry 🍟 fanatic. Especially when they are freshly cut and this happens to now be his favorite thing and money maker for his little league football organization!! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid machine
customer_reviews.text: Well made machine, 3 top quality blades. Only short fall in the hopper the potato goes in is small, have to cut larger potatoes to fit into cutter.
customer_reviews.author: TBO

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very small and hard to use. Not high-quality plastic either. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: grodmccloskey

customer_reviews.title: Only for small potatos
customer_reviews.text: Pros. It cut potato’s easily, easy to clean, easy to use, small and light weight. Cons. Too small to fit potato’s. I had mine for 6 months and pushed Richard and snapped the thing in half.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's doesn't push potatoes all the way through, the ends get stuck on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: dianadee

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy...breaks after 1 use!
customer_reviews.text: Broke apart after two usages...total waste of money. Do not waste the $25 on this piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: Beth Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S. - couldn't cut its way out of a paper bag
customer_reviews.text: Bent the blades on the first attempt at making sweet potato fries. Don't bother with this one.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Very small!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a mini cutter! Do not waste your money. It will only cut potatoes that are 1 inch by 2 inch cubes not for a normal bag of potatoes
customer_reviews.author: slhcup

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Operate.  Too Small for Many Average Size Spuds
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to push the potato through. Too small for many average sized potatoes. Suction cup stopped working. Definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just got a refund. This fry cutter is awful. Do not waste your time buying it. It’s flimsy and poorly made. You have to cut up the potatoes to put them into this which defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Brindle

customer_reviews.title: French fries!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this yet but it looks well put together and I am looking forward to using it. It looks similar to one we used as kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Westmark Multipurpose French Fry Cutter with 3 Thickness Adjustable Stainless Steel Blades and Non-Slip Suction Pad (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Size:One SizeFeatures:
- (3) High quality stainless steel blade grids
- (1) 9x9mm blade grid
- (1) 10x10mm blade grid
- (1) 12x12mm blade grid
- ABS base and handle
- Ergonomic steel handle
- Non-slip suction pad

About the Brand:
HIGHEST QUALITY WITH TREND AND TRADITION! Westmark of Germany is well known for its quality craftsmanship of kitchen gadgets. Westmark has been making reliable kitchen products for over 50 years. As a specialized and reliable partner, Westmark offers a wide range of practical and uncomplicated kitchen products designed to make cooking and life in the kitchen easier. For traditional reasons, Westmark produces most of their products in Elspe, Germany. 

Money Back Guarantee: If you are not happy with our product, simply return the item to Amazon for a full refund, but we are confident that you will LOVE our product!
feature_bullets: MATERIAL: Each product is made using high quality stainless steel blade inserts with an ABS base and handle. Included is a rubber suction unit to ensure a tight and secure hold. See below for more details.

EASY AND READY TO USE: This easy to use product comes with three different inserts for three different sizes to cut. One insert measures 9x9mm, another measures 10x10mm, and lastly another measuring at 12x12mm. The smaller the measurement of an insert, the larger your fries will be. Not only can this product create fries from potatoes, but it can also manage other vegetables or fruits such as carrots, cucumbers, apples, and much more! Equipped with an ergonomic handle, Westmark’s product is efficient and comfortable to use.
EASY TO CLEAN: Simply use soap and water to clean the product.
5 YEAR WARRANTY: Backed with a 5 year warranty, Westmark is completely confident that you will love their product or we will refund your money back, no questions asked!
GERMAN ENGINEERED HIGH QUALITY KITCHENWARE: Westmark’s French Fry Cutter is among the best in the world and is rated to be one of the best kitchenware brands available today.
